creator: messeacees

title: Firefox Sync messes up Bookmarks (sort order, multiple instances) - 6+ Year Old Problem
content:
Very long-standing issue that keeps getting closed without resolution. My bookmarks won't stay sorted in the Bookmark Menus folder. The last solution I saw is a broken link having to do with corrupt 'Places'. Doesn't work anyway. I only have another device syncing with Firefox and not very often because I seldom use that laptop. Always this desktop.

I do have a lot of bookmarks over the years and it just keeps getting worse. If I Manage Bookmarks and sort them, they only stay sorted as long as I open that window separately. When I close it, the bookmarks are unsorted again. When will Firefox fix this? It's leaving a mess that is making my bookmarks unusable. When I click on that tab, I expect to see a bunch of folders, then files. Instead, I see files, then folders somewhere in the middle, mixed with other folders I don't even use, then a bunch more files. Sort by name doesn't show up as an option if I right click in the middle of all the files I see.

I have tried to delete those files, but they won't stay deleted. It's pulling them from somewhere, but I don't know where that 'somewhere' is. Does anybody have an idea how to contact Firefox tech support for an answer? Nobody seems to know what's going on with this issue. I won't list all my bookmarks, because some are more personal than others. This is just an idea. Please be nice. I've been using Firefox forever and a day.
creator: RayGibson57

title: When fulscreening a youtube video, the window does not take up my entire screen.
content: After I restart my computer and I open firefox, then fullscreen a youtube video there is always a transparent thick line around the top and left edge of the screen which shows whatever is behind it (e.g. my wallpaper). If I go out of fullscreen and back into it, then it's fixed but I have to do this every time I start firefox.

title: Can you disable Saved Credit Card behavior on individual sites?
content:
110.0.1 (64 bit) on Windows 10.

I frequently use the Saved Credit Card feature for my own purchases.

However, I also have a side business where I process customer cards using Stripe. Every time I want to enter/modify a customer's card info, Firefox wants to autofill MY saved card information. While I can work around this, 1) It's annoying; 2) One day I might slip-up, and not notice I accidentally let Firefox autofill my card info in place of a customer's card info. That would be bad.

Is there a way to disable the Saved Credit Card on individual web sites? In my case, I want it OFF on Stripe.com, and ON everywhere else.

Thanks for any info.
creator: larrycoon

title: breech

creator: ruskman78

title: UI of PiP media control buttons are off-center in latest 110.0.0 version
content:
From within 'about:config' I have the pref value of 'media.videocontrols.picture-in-picture.improved-video-controls.enabled' set to true, but ever since updating Firefox itself from the 109 version to the 110.0.0 version - the UI of the media controls in PiP mode appear to be off-center.

Previous to updating to the 110.0.0 version - the UI of the media control buttons in PiP mode were shifted more to the left which made the UI of the media control buttons look neater and cleaner.

So the time code section showing you how much of the video you have currently watched and also how long the duration of the video actually is, was displayed further to the left side of the floating window screen, and the other media controls like the 'back to tab button', the 'backward seek button', the 'play button', the 'forward seek button', the 'mute button', and the 'fullscreen button' were also placed and spaced more to the left side of the floating window screen as well.

Attached is a picture of what the UI of the media controls in PiP now looks like in the latest 110.0.0 version.

Does it look 'off-center' like this for anyone else too?
creator: thethingking91

title: Won't save logins
content: This version of Firefox, 110 will not save logins or ask if I want to save them. I have logged into Google and Mozilla but they are not saved. I also have that "Your browser is being managed by your organization." again. I'm running Windows 11 Pro 22H2 on my Dell Inspiron 5759 laptop. I'm not sure what else to provide for details. I actually have two of the laptops and they both will not save logins in Firefox 110. I changed the policy for Firefox in Regedit but that didn't help getting rid of the GPO notice. Both of these computers are for personal use only. I don't know if there is a conflict between Firefox 110 and Windows 11 Pro. I have used Firefox for many, many years with few issues. I don't like Chrome but I guess I'll try it.
creator: leoman1
